jot.manager

Class SceneManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • jot.manager.SceneManager

  • public class SceneManager
extends Object
    Class that implements a scene manager.
    Author:
    G. Amador & A. Gomes

    • Constructor Detail

      • SceneManager

        public SceneManager(ConcurrentHashMap<String,String> texturesPaths)
        Constructor, initializes all data structures to players, mutable and immutable objects. Also, loads all textures to further usage in rendering.
        Parameters:
        texturesPaths - all textures to further usage in rendering.

      • SceneManager

        public SceneManager(ConcurrentHashMap<String,String> texturesPaths,
                    int width,
                    int height,
                    ThreadLocal<Random> random)
        Constructor, initializes all data structures to players, mutable and immutable objects. Also, loads all textures to further usage in rendering.
        Parameters:
        texturesPaths - all textures to further usage in rendering.
        width - of the image to generate when RayTracing.
        height - of the image to generate when RayTracing.
        random -

        Intensify the brightness of a given value x.
        Parameters:
        x - a given value x.
        Returns:
        the brightness of a given value x intensified, i.e., clamp(x)^(1/2.2).

      • buildBlock

        public GameObject buildBlock(String id,
                             String texture,
                             float side,
                             AbstractBoundingVolume.BoundingVolumeType boundingVolumeType)
        Create a block obstacle, i.e., set texture, light/material properties, vertex, normals and textureCoords values.
        Parameters:
        id - the unique identifier of the obstacle.
        texture - the texture path to map.
        side - the size of the block side.
        boundingVolumeType - the type of BoundingVolume that must engulf this model.
        Returns:
        a gameObject which contains a mesh regarding the obstacle data.

      • buildCelestialObject

        public GameObject buildCelestialObject(String celestialObjectId,
                                       float rotationIncrement,
                                       float radius,
                                       String texture)
        Build the astronomical/celestial object, i.e., set texture, light/material properties, vertex, normals and textureCoords values.
        Parameters:
        celestialObjectId - the unique identifier of the astronomical/celestial object.
        rotationIncrement - the rotation to increment at each render.
        radius - the value of the astronomical/celestial object radius.
        texture - the name and path of the texture for the astronomical/celestial object.
        Returns:
        a gameObject which contains a mesh regarding the astronomical/celestial object data.

      • buildFloor

        public TransformGroup buildFloor(float size,
                                 String texture)
        Build a plane floor, i.e., set texture, light/material properties, vertex, normals and textureCoords values.
        Parameters:
        size - absolute size value of one of the sides of the square that defines the floor, i.e., floor as size*size area.
        texture - the name and path of the texture for the floor.
        Returns:
        a gameObject which contains a mesh regarding the floor data.

      • buildMaze

        public TransformGroup buildMaze(AbstractMazeGenerator mazeGenerator)
        Build a maze floor.
        Parameters:
        mazeGenerator - the maze generator to use.
        Returns:
        a gameObject which contains a mesh regarding the floor data.

      • buildSkyBox

        public TransformGroup buildSkyBox(float skySize,
                                  String texturePrefix,
                                  String textureExtension)
        Build the SkyBox, i.e., set texture, light/material properties, vertex, normals and textureCoords values.
        Parameters:
        skySize - absolute size value of one of the sides of the square that defines the floor, i.e., floor as size*size area.
        texturePrefix - the common string in the name of each of the textures that make up the SkyBox.
        textureExtension - the file extension for the given textures in the texture path, assuming all textures have the same extension.
        Returns:
        a gameObject which contains a mesh regarding the SkyBox data.

      • buildSkyDome

        public TransformGroup buildSkyDome(float radius,
                                   String texture)
        Build the SkyDome, i.e., set texture, light/material properties, vertex, normals and textureCoords values.
        Parameters:
        radius - of the SkyDome.
        texture - the name and path of the texture for the SkyDome.
        Returns:
        a gameObject which contains a mesh regarding the SkyDome data.

      • buildSmoothTerrain

        public TransformGroup buildSmoothTerrain(String texture,
                                         int smoothFactor,
                                         AbstractTerrainGenerator terrainGenerator,
                                         AbstractSurface terrainSmoother)
        Build a irregular smooth terrain floor.
        Parameters:
        texture - the name and path of the texture for the floor.
        smoothFactor - relates to the amount of extra points required to generate for the surface smoothing.
        terrainGenerator - the terrain generator to use.
        terrainSmoother - the terrain generator smooth logic to use.
        Returns:
        a gameObject which contains a mesh regarding the floor data.

      • buildTerrain

        public TransformGroup buildTerrain(String texture,
                                   AbstractTerrainGenerator terrainGenerator)
        Build a irregular terrain floor.
        Parameters:
        texture - the name and path of the texture for the floor.
        terrainGenerator - the terrain generator to use.
        Returns:
        a gameObject which contains a mesh regarding the floor data.

        public void render(com.jogamp.opengl.GL2 gl)
        Render all the gameObjects and their associated meshes in the managed scene graph.
        Parameters:
        gl -

        public void dispose(com.jogamp.opengl.GL2 gl)
        Dispose all the game content.
        Parameters:
        gl -

      • updateCamera

        public void updateCamera(float dt)
        Update the default camera and the RayTracer camera.
        Parameters:
        dt - the amount of elapsed game time since the last frame.

      • updatePlayerName

        public void updatePlayerName(String oldId,
                             String newId)
        Change a player Id.
        Parameters:
        oldId - the player Id to change.
        newId - the new player Id.

      • updateMutableObjects

        public void updateMutableObjects(float dt)
        Update all mutable objects position in the managed scene, if the mutable object life span ends or if it hits some obstacle remove it from the managed scene.
        Parameters:
        dt - the amount of elapsed game time since the last frame.

      • checkImmutableObjectMutableObjectCollision

        public int checkImmutableObjectMutableObjectCollision(GameObject immutableObject)
        Test for all mutable objects in the managed scene if any collides with a GameObject from a given immutable object in the managed scene.
        Parameters:
        immutableObject - given immutable or mutable object, or player's GameObject.
        Returns:
        TRUE if collision occurs, FALSE otherwise.

      • checkMutableObjectMutableObjectCollision

        public int checkMutableObjectMutableObjectCollision(GameObject mutableObject)
        Test for all mutable objects in the managed scene if any collides with a GameObject from a given mutable object in the managed scene.
        Parameters:
        mutableObject - given immutable or mutable object, or player's GameObject.
        Returns:
        TRUE if collision occurs, FALSE otherwise.

      • checkPlayerImmutableObjectCollision

        public boolean checkPlayerImmutableObjectCollision(GameObject player)
        Test if a given player collides with any of the immutable objects in the managed scene.
        Parameters:
        player - given player.
        Returns:
        TRUE if collision occurs, FALSE otherwise.

      • checkPlayerMutableObjectCollision

        public int checkPlayerMutableObjectCollision(GameObject player)
        Test for all mutable objects in the managed scene if any collides with a GameObject from a given player in the managed scene.
        Parameters:
        player - given player's gameObject. GameObject. it hits an player.
        Returns:
        TRUE if collision occurs, FALSE otherwise.

      • checkPlayerPlayerCollision

        public String checkPlayerPlayerCollision(GameObject player)
        Test if a given player collides with any of the players in the scene.
        Parameters:
        player - given player.
        Returns:
        String of player with which collision occurs, NULL otherwise.

      • checkSceneBoundsCollision

        public boolean checkSceneBoundsCollision(AbstractBoundingVolume boundingVolume)
        Test if a given bounding volume collides with the scene SkyBox/SkyDome boundaries.
        Parameters:
        boundingVolume - of a given player.
        Returns:
        TRUE if collision occurs, FALSE otherwise.

      • RayTrace

        public void RayTrace(int RAYTRACER_CANVAS_WIDTH,
                     int RAYTRACER_CANVAS_HEIGHT,
                     int samples)
        Perform a RayTracer pass to the scene and generate the corresponding texture.
        Parameters:
        RAYTRACER_CANVAS_WIDTH -
        RAYTRACER_CANVAS_HEIGHT -
        samples -

      • setupGeometries2Render

        public void setupGeometries2Render()
        Add all game objects simplexes to the shapes list, apply affine transforms and setup lights.

      • intersect

        public IntersectionResult intersect(Ray ray)
        For a provided Ray test if any of the shapes in the scene intersects said ray.
        Parameters:
        ray - a provided Ray.
        Returns:
        the intersection result of ray with all the shapes in the scene.
